data.event: Conway was first settled in 1762 as the southwest portion of Deerfield.
The town was eventually separated and was officially incorporated in 1767.

event.title: other agrarian pursuits in its early years

data.event: (Conway, New Hampshire, as well as other towns across the country, were also named for him.) The town was known for its sheep farming and other agrarian pursuits in its early years, with some industry along the South River which was washed out in a dam break in 1869.

event.title: was washed out in a dam break in 1869
